trans-unit.source: Lists 404 Not Found requests. Can be used to reduce the amount of broken links or invalid URLs by e.g. creating redirects for them. Click on this message for more detailed information.

• Status: Shows at a glance, what the current state of the 404-error is.
    • New: This 404-error has appeared for the first time. This means, that the corresponding URL was only called once.
    • New hits: This 404-error has appeared multiple times.
    • Resolved : This 404-error is marked as "resolved" and has never reappeared since them.
    • Reappeared: This 404-error was marked as "resolved", but has reappeared since then again. Also check "Has-reappeared count".
  • URL: The URL that lead to this 404-error.
  • Hit count: Counts how often this 404-error has appeared. Every request to this URL increases this counter.
  • Has-reappeared count: This counter will be increased, when a previously "resolved" 404-error has reappeared again afterwards. This can point to some ongoing problem with the URL even after it was marked as "resolved".
  • Actions: Functions to manage this 404-error.
